wikipedia_page.main:
Charles Andrews is Organist at Temple Church, London, having been Associate Director of Music, All Saints, Margaret Street from 2011-2016. He studied organ at the Royal College of Music with David Graham and Sophie-Véronique Cauchefer-Choplin, with the support of a Douglas and Kyra Downie Award.
He was Accompanist to Hertfordshire Chorus from 2011-2018. Prior to his appointment at All Saints, Margaret Street he held posts at St John's, Hyde Park, Chelmsford Cathedral, and the Michael James organ scholarship at Rochester Cathedral.
Engagements in 2012 include the premiere of David Briggs Mosaïque for organ duo, with Roger Sayer.

response: * Charles Andrews (Maine politician) (1814–1852), US Representative from Maine
* Charles Andrews (judge) (1827–1918), Chief Judge of the NY Court of Appeals 1881–1882 and 1893–1897 and Mayor of Syracuse, New York
